channel.title: Reference Types and Value Types :: Data Structures in C#
channel.description: Reference Types and Value Types Data types in C# come in two distinct flavors: value types and reference types. In order to understand the distinction, it helps to consider how space is allocated in C#. Whenever a method is called, the space needed to execute that method is allocated from a data structure known as the call stack.
